In recent weeks, GE Vernova raised its multi-year financial outlook, doubled its quarterly dividend, expanded its share repurchase authorization to US$10.00 billion, and secured multiâ€‘gigawatt HVDC grid contracts in India and Germany that deepen its Electrification backlog. Together with plans to acquire full ownership of transformer maker Prolec GE, these moves suggest GE Vernova is positioning its portfolio tightly around accelerating global grid constraints, data center power needs, and...
